content: It is the latest twist over the fate of Lungu's body, which remains in a South African morgue since his death.

title: Colombia to resume peace talks with ECG after temporary suspension

title: Warner Bros rejects latest Paramount bid but open to ‘best and final’ offer

originalTitle: US and Iran reach ‘guiding principles’ in Geneva nuclear talks
title: US and Iran reach ‘guiding principles’ in Geneva nuclear talks
content: The US and Iran reached an understanding on key “guiding principles” at indirect nuclear talks in Geneva.

originalTitle: US civil rights leader Jesse Jackson dies aged 84
title: Jesse Jackson, A Big Helper, Goes To Rest
content:
Sad News About a Kind Man

Hello, my little friends in Africa! I have some sad news to share with you today. A very special man from far away America has gone to rest. His name was Jesse Jackson. He was 84 years old. That's a lot of birthdays! Jesse Jackson was a very, very kind man. He helped so many people during his long life. He worked hard to make the world a better, fairer place for everyone. Even though he lived in America, his good heart and his wish for fairness touched people all over the world.

Who Was Jesse Jackson?

Jesse Jackson was like a superhero, but instead of a cape, he used his voice and his kindness. He was born in America a long, long time ago. When he was a boy, some people were not treated nicely because of their skin color. This made Jesse very sad. He believed that everyone, no matter how they look or where they come from, should be treated with love and respect. He wanted everyone to have the same chances in life. He wanted good schools for all children. He wanted safe homes for all families. He wanted kind words for every person. Did you know? Jesse Jackson was also a church leader! He was a pastor. He helped many people with his kind words and wise advice from the church too.

Fighting for Fairness

Jesse Jackson became a "civil rights leader." This is a big name, but it just means he was a special helper. He helped people get their "civil rights." What are civil rights? They are the rules that say everyone should be treated fairly by their government and by other people. They mean you have the right to be safe, to learn, to work, and to be treated with respect. Long ago, in America, some people with dark skin were not allowed to do the same things as people with light skin. They could not sit in the same buses. They could not go to the same schools. This was very unfair! Jesse Jackson said, "This is not right!" He stood up for these people. He spoke in front of many crowds. He marched peacefully with his friends. He wanted everyone to see that unfairness was wrong. He worked very hard to change these old, bad rules.

Making Big Changes

People called Jesse Jackson an "agent of change." What does that mean? It means he was like a special mover! He helped move things from bad to good. He helped change the way people thought. He helped change the unfair rules. He was like a brave leader who showed everyone how to be kind and fair. He helped make big, good changes that stayed for a very long time. He helped make sure that children of all colors could go to the same schools. He helped make sure people could sit anywhere they wanted on a bus. He helped make sure everyone had a chance to vote and choose their leaders. These were very important changes! Did you know? Jesse Jackson was so brave, he even tried to become the President of America! That's like trying to be the top leader of his whole country! He wanted to help even more people if he became President.

A Friend to Everyone

Jesse Jackson wasn't just a helper in America. He helped people all over the world too! He believed that we are all part of one big family, no matter where we live. He traveled to many different countries. He helped people who were in trouble. He helped people who were sick. He helped people who needed someone to speak up for them. He helped bring people together. He taught everyone that we should love each other and work together. He showed us that even small acts of kindness can make a big difference. Sometimes, when people were in a difficult situation far away, Jesse Jackson would fly there to help. He would talk to leaders. He would try to make peace. He was truly a friend to everyone.

Remembering Jesse Jackson

Now that Jesse Jackson has gone to rest, many people are sad. People who help run the country, called "politicians," have said many kind things about him. They said he was a "transformative leader." That means he helped make really big, good changes that changed things forever. They said he helped make the world better. They remember his brave heart and his kind smile. They remember how he always spoke up for what was right. Did you know? Jesse Jackson was very good at speaking. He had a strong voice that made people listen and think. He used his words to inspire hope and courage in others. We will always remember Jesse Jackson as a hero. A hero who wanted fairness for everyone. A hero who taught us to be kind. A hero who showed us how to make the world a better place. Let's all try to be a little bit like Jesse Jackson every day. Let's be kind. Let's be fair. Let's help each other. His memory will live on in all the good things he did. He left the world a much, much kinder place. And that is a wonderful thing.
summary: Jesse Jackson, a kind American leader, helped many people get fair treatment and made the world a better place before he went to rest at 84 years old.
whyMatters: His work matters because he taught us all to be kind, treat everyone fairly, and always speak up for what is right, making the world a much better place for future generations.

originalTitle: Nine arrested in France over death of far-right student
title: Nine arrested in France over death of far-right student
content: Quentin Deranque died on Saturday, two days after being beaten in Lyon by masked men believed to be far-left militants.

originalTitle: First day of Russia-Ukraine peace talks ends in Geneva
title: First day of Russia-Ukraine peace talks ends in Geneva
content: Negotiations will continue on Wednesday, but expectations for a breakthrough on ending the war are low.

originalTitle: Real Madrid tie halted over Vinicius racism allegation
title: Real Madrid tie halted over Vinicius racism allegation
content: Real Madrid's Champions League knockout phase play-off tie at Benfica is halted for 10 minutes after Vinicius Junior reports alleged racist abuse.

originalTitle: Arsenal make Saka best-paid player with new five-year deal
title: Arsenal make Saka best-paid player with new five-year deal
content: England winger Bukayo Saka commits his future to Premier League leaders Arsenal by signing a new five-year deal.

originalTitle: Feyenoord training moved to Belgium for Sterling
title: Feyenoord training moved to Belgium for Sterling
content: Feyenoord will train in Belgium this week instead of their home in Rotterdam so new signing Raheem Sterling can work with his new team-mates.
